Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.telemetry.protobuf

Interface ProtobufHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultProtobufHandler
    public interface ProtobufHandler
    Handler interface for push-based protobuf parsing.

    The parser calls these methods as it encounters fields in the protobuf wire format. The handler is responsible for interpreting the values based on schema knowledge.

    Wire Type to Handler Method Mapping

    • VARINT (0) → handleVarint(int, long)
    • I64 (1) → handleFixed64(int, long)
    • LEN (2) → handleBytes(int, ByteBuffer) or startMessage(int)/endMessage()
    • I32 (5) → handleFixed32(int, int)

    Value Interpretation

    The handler must interpret raw wire values according to the schema:

    • Varint → int32, int64, uint32, uint64, sint32 (zigzag), sint64 (zigzag), bool, enum
    • Fixed64 → fixed64, sfixed64, double
    • Fixed32 → fixed32, sfixed32, float
    • Bytes → bytes, string (UTF-8), packed repeated fields

    Embedded Messages

    When the parser encounters a length-delimited field that the handler identifies as an embedded message (via isMessage(int)), it calls startMessage(int) before parsing the nested content and endMessage() after. If isMessage returns false, the raw bytes are delivered via handleBytes(int, ByteBuffer).

    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    ProtobufParser

      void endMessage()
      Called when parsing completes for an embedded message.
      void handleBytes​(int fieldNumber, java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
      Called when a length-delimited field is encountered that is not a message.

    • Method Detail

      • handleVarint

        void handleVarint​(int fieldNumber,
                  long value)
        Called when a varint field is encountered.

        The value may represent: int32, int64, uint32, uint64, bool, or enum. For sint32/sint64, apply zigzag decoding: (value >>> 1) ^ -(value & 1)

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number
        value - the raw varint value (unsigned)

      • handleFixed64

        void handleFixed64​(int fieldNumber,
                   long value)
        Called when a fixed 64-bit field is encountered.

        The value may represent: fixed64, sfixed64, or double. For double, use Double.longBitsToDouble(value).

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number
        value - the 64-bit value

      • handleFixed32

        void handleFixed32​(int fieldNumber,
                   int value)
        Called when a fixed 32-bit field is encountered.

        The value may represent: fixed32, sfixed32, or float. For float, use Float.intBitsToFloat(value).

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number
        value - the 32-bit value

      • handleBytes

        void handleBytes​(int fieldNumber,
                 java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        Called when a length-delimited field is encountered that is not a message.

        The data may represent: bytes, string (UTF-8), or packed repeated fields. The buffer is positioned at the start of the data and has exactly the field's length remaining.

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number
        data - the field data (read-only view)

      • isMessage

        boolean isMessage​(int fieldNumber)
        Returns true if the given field number represents an embedded message.

        The parser calls this to determine whether to recursively parse a length-delimited field as a message or deliver it as raw bytes.

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number
        Returns:
        true if this field is an embedded message

      • startMessage

        void startMessage​(int fieldNumber)
        Called when parsing begins for an embedded message.

        The handler should push any state needed to track the nested context. All subsequent handler calls relate to fields within this message until endMessage() is called.

        Parameters:
        fieldNumber - the field number of the message field

      • endMessage

        void endMessage()
        Called when parsing completes for an embedded message.

        The handler should pop the nested context and return to the parent.
